channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Zelensky's 'man for all seasons' ensnared in corruption probe
item.description: Ask Ukrainians who the country's most powerful figure is after the president and many will say Andriy Yermak, his chief of staff and a key negotiator during four years of war when Western financial and military aid has kept Kyiv in the fight. Yermak, a friend of President Volodymyr Zelensky and hi

item.title: British globe trekker faces changed world on final leg of 27-year journey
item.description: Karl Bushby, a British ex-paratrooper who set out in 1998 to walk around the world, is on the final stretch of his 27-year-long trek home, and trying to cope with social media pressure in a world that has changed profoundly. Walking in pouring rain in northwest Hungary, Bushby, 56, who started out

item.title: Russia says its proposals on New START arms treaty are intended to prevent negative global scenarios
item.description: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said on Wednesday that Moscow's proposals regarding the New START nuclear arms control treaty are designed to prevent negative global scenarios. Earlier, President Putin offered to voluntarily uphold the limits capping the size of the world's two larg

item.title: French poll shows far-right leader Bardella winning presidential election
item.description: French pollster Odoxa predicted for the first time that 30-year-old far-right leader Jordan Bardella would win the next presidential election, scheduled in 2027, no matter who his opponents would be. The current president of far-right National Rally (RN) party, and heir to long-time leader Marine

item.title: BBC not ‘institutionally biased’: memo author
item.description: The author of a report that plunged the BBC into crisis said the broadcaster was not "institutionally biased", and he had hoped his criticisms would lead to improvements. Michael Prescott, a former editorial advisor, compiled a dossier on issues within BBC News, including failings in the editing o

item.title: Spain exhumes victim of Franco-era killings in ongoing recovery effort
item.description: Jose Luis Cubo watched as forensic scientists dug up the body of a man his grandfather had helped to bury at the start of the Spanish Civil War in 1936 after an execution by fascist forces. The remains pulled from a muddy pit in Vegas de Matute farmland, 75 km (47 miles) north of Madrid, are

item.title: Ukraine says it received 1,000 bodies from Russia
item.description: Ukraine received 1,000 bodies of what Russia says are fallen Ukrainian servicemen, Kyiv's prisoner-of-war coordination centre said on Thursday. "Investigators from law enforcement bodies, together with expert agencies of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, will soon conduct all necessary examination

item.title: Europeans push back at US plan that would force concessions from Ukraine
item.description: European countries pushed back on Thursday against a US-backed peace plan for Ukraine that sources said would require Kyiv to give up more land and partially disarm, conditions long seen by Ukraine's allies as tantamount to capitulation. Two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesda

item.title: Spain to investigate Meta, alleges Android privacy breaches
item.description: Spain's parliament will investigate Meta (META.O), opens new tab for possible privacy violations of its Facebook and Instagram users, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Wednesday. "In Spain, the law is above any algorithm or any large technology platform. And anyone who violates ou

item.title: Spanish court conditionally releases PM's former ally from jail
item.description: Spain's Supreme Court ordered on Wednesday the provisional release from jail of a former senior official within the ruling Socialist Party, citing reduced risk of evidence tampering amid an ongoing corruption investigation. Santos Cerdan, who had been remanded in custody since June, faces potentia

item.title: Ten killed and 40 wounded in heavy Russian attack on Ukraine, officials say
item.description: Ten people were killed in a heavy overnight Russian missile and drone attack that struck a residential tower block in the western Ukrainian city of Ternopil, Ukrainian officials said on Wednesday. Another 40 people were wounded in the overnight strikes on Ukraine that targeted energy and transport

item.title: Zelenskiy says Kyiv ready for peace talks, but will not cede territory
item.description:
Ukraine is ready for peace talks but will not withdraw its troops from additional territory first as Moscow has demanded, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.
In comments to reporters released on Tuesday, he said he was happy for talks to be held anywhere, except in Russia itself or on the

item.title: Trump vows migration freeze after DC attack
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration will "permanently pause" migration from all "Third World Countries", following the death of a National Guard member in an attack near the White House. The comments mark a further escalation of migration measures Trump has ordered since

item.title: China calls on UK to uphold 'one-China' principle
item.description: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi called on Britain on Friday to uphold the "one-China" principle, as Beijing seeks to rally support in its worst diplomatic dispute with Tokyo in years over democratically-governed Taiwan. The "One China" principle, which Beijing views as meaning both sides of the T

item.title: Belarus leader visits Myanmar ahead of disputed election
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko arrived in Myanmar on a goodwill visit, state media reported Friday, becoming only the second foreign leader to set foot in the country since the military seized power in 2021. The trip comes weeks before a national election widely dismissed by critics as

item.title: Hong Kong tower fire toll rises to 128, 200 remain missing
item.description: The death toll from Hong Kong's worst fire in nearly 80 years has risen to 128 and about 200 people remain missing from the high-rise residential complex that was engulfed by the blaze, the city's security chief said on Friday. The fire in the Wang Fuk Court development, with eight 32-storey tower

item.title: Showdown with Mexican billionaire Salinas tests Sheinbaum's power
Trump says he may cut income tax 'completely' because of tariff income
Trump administration to carry out sweeping immigration review after National Guard shooting
National Guard member dies as ambush in US capital becomes political flashpoint
Trump says US will soon take action against Venezuelan drug traffickers on land
US budget deficit hits $284b in October
Trump begins process of labeling Muslim Brotherhood chapters as terrorist
Brazil's ex-president Bolsonaro detained by police ahead of vigil
Trump officials prepare for potential shakeup after one-year mark, CNN reports
Five tourists killed in Chile snowstorm
Trump says Cambodia, Thailand going to be fine after calls over conflict
President Trump signs government funding bill, ending shutdown after a record 43-day disruption
Israeli raid in southern Syria leaves 13 dead
item.description: Thirteen people were killed in an Israeli raid in southern Syria on Friday, Syrian state media reported, with Damascus accusing Israel of a "criminal attack" in a village where Israel said its troops came under fire during an operation to arrest militants. The Israeli military said six soldiers we

item.title: Venezuela revokes flight rights for six airlines amid escalating US tensions
item.description: Venezuela has revoked operating rights for six major international airlines which suspended flights to the country following a warning from the US Federal Aviation Administration. The civil aviation authority revoked permits for Iberia, TAP, Avianca, Latam Colombia, Turkish Airlines and Gol, which

item.title: 'Like an ocean': Malaysians recall race against rising waters after major flood
item.description: Gon Qasim and her husband were about to flee their home in Malaysia's northern Perlis state last weekend when rising floodwaters cut off road access, leaving them stranded in the middle of a field. The elderly couple were eventually rescued by one of their children living nearby and taken to an ev

item.title: Imran Khan healthy, not shifted anywhere: Adiala jail admin
item.description: Pakistan's Adiala jail administration on Wednesday dismissed circulating rumours claiming the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan had been moved out of the facility, insisting he remained inside the prison and was in good health, according to Geo News. "There is no truth to rep

item.title: At least four dead after fire engulfs residential high-rise buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: Frames of scaffolding were seen tumbling to the ground as firefighters battled the blaze, while scores of fire engines and ambulances lined the road below the complex, according to Reuters witnesses. Wang Fuk Court is one of many high-rise housing complexes in Hong Kong, which is one of the most d

item.title: Taiwan plans extra $40 billion in defence spending to counter China
item.description: Taiwan will introduce a $40-billion supplementary defence budget to underscore its determination to defend itself in the face of a rising threat from China, President Lai Ching-te said on Wednesday. China, which views democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory, has ramped up military and

item.title: Malaysian floods affect 11,000 people across seven states
item.description: More than 11,000 people in seven Malaysian states have been affected by flooding caused by torrential rain, the national disaster agency said on Monday. Floods are common on the eastern coast of Malaysia during the annual monsoon season from October until March, with thousands of people displaced

item.title: Minor earthquake felt in Saudi Arabia
item.description: The Saudi Geological Survey (SGS) recorded two earthquakes on Saturday - one in Saudi Arabia and another in Iraq, media reports said. According to the SGS, its National Seismic Monitoring Network detected a minor quake about 86km northwest of Harrat Al Shaqa, situated between Al-Ais in the Madinah

item.title: Hamas delegation in Cairo to discuss Gaza ceasefire, sources say
item.description: A Hamas delegation was in Cairo on Sunday to meet with Gaza war mediators, an Egyptian security source and a Hamas source said, as both Israel and the Palestinian militant group continue to trade accusations of ceasefire violations. The Hamas official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said the

item.title: 5.3 magnitude earthquake jolts Myanmar coast
item.description: A 5.3-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Myanmar at 10:39 am (Bangladesh time) on Sunday at a depth of 10km. The tremor also affected neighbouring Thailand. According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the epicentre was located in the Andaman Sea, about 267 kilometres west-so

item.title: Israeli airstrikes kill 14 people in Gaza, medics say
item.description: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza killed at least 14 people and wounded several others, local health authorities said on Saturday, in a further test of a fragile ceasefire between the Palestinian militant group Hamas and Israel. Witnesses and medics said the first attack hit a car in the densely populate

item.title: Indian Tejas fighter jet crashes, killing pilot
item.description: An Indian home-produced Tejas fighter jet crashed at the Dubai Air Show during an aerial display on Friday, killing its pilot, the Indian Air Force said. The fighter was flying at a low altitude at around 2:15pm (1015 GMT) before coming down in a ball of fire, according to a witness. Footage from
